issue.title: Build SplitSync (Expense Sharing App)
issue.body:
# Product Requirements Document: SplitSync
## Expense Sharing Application

**Version:** 3.0  
**Status:** Production-Ready MVP  
**Last Updated:** January 2026

---

## Executive Summary

SplitSync is a real-time expense sharing application that allows groups to track shared expenses, calculate optimal debt settlements, and manage group finances transparently. The system prioritizes financial accuracy, security, and operational reliability for production deployment.

---

## Tech Stack
- Node.js 20 LTS (aligns with Next.js 16 requirements)
- Next.js 16.1.4 (App Router)  
- TypeScript 5.9.3 (strict mode)
- SQLite (via better-sqlite3 12.6.2)
- Drizzle ORM 0.45.1
- Zod 4.3.5
- NextAuth.js 4.24.13 (track v5 release for future upgrade)
- Socket.io 4.8.3
- Tailwind CSS 4.1.18 + @shadcn/ui 0.0.4
- React Hook Form 7.71.1
- Vitest 4.0.17 (unit & integration tests)
- Playwright 1.50.0 (E2E tests with full browser automation)
- GitHub Actions CI/CD (lint, typecheck, test, build pipelines)

---

## 1. Technical Architecture

### 1.1 Technology Stack

**Core Framework:**
- Node.js 20 LTS runtime environment
- Next.js 16.1.4 with App Router architecture
- TypeScript 5.9.3 in strict mode for type safety

**Data Layer:**
- SQLite database via better-sqlite3 12.6.2
- Drizzle ORM 0.45.1 for type-safe database operations
- Zod 4.3.5 for runtime schema validation

**Authentication & Real-time:**
- NextAuth.js 4.24.13 for authentication flows (monitor v5 for future migration)
- Socket.io 4.8.3 for real-time bidirectional communication

**User Interface:**
- Tailwind CSS 4.1.18 for utility-first styling
- shadcn/ui 0.0.4 component library
- React Hook Form 7.71.1 for form state management

**Testing & CI/CD:**
- Vitest 4.0.17 (unit & integration tests)
- Playwright 1.50.0 (E2E tests with full browser automation)
- Vitest 4.0.17 for unit and integration testing
- GitHub Actions for continuous integration and deployment
- Docker for containerized deployment

### 1.2 Core Functional Requirements

**Group Management:**
- Create and manage expense sharing groups
- Generate secure, time-limited invite links
- Role-based member management (admin, member)
- Group archival and deletion with data retention policies

**Expense Tracking:**
- Record expenses with metadata (description, amount, payer, date)
- Equal split calculation across group members
- Expense categorization and tagging
- Expense editing with audit trail
- Attachment support for receipts

**Settlement Engine:**
- Debt graph calculation from expense history
- Optimal settlement path computation (minimize transactions)
- Settlement marking and tracking
- Settlement history and verification

**Real-time Synchronization:**
- Live expense updates across all group members
- Real-time balance recalculation
- Connection state management and reconnection logic
- Optimistic UI updates with conflict resolution

**Authentication & Authorization:**
- Google OAuth provider integration
- Email/password credential authentication
- Session management with secure token handling
- Protected routes and API endpoints
- Role-based access control per group

---

## 2. Non-Functional Requirements

### 2.1 Data Integrity & Financial Accuracy

**Money Handling:**
- All monetary values stored as integers representing smallest currency unit (cents)
- No floating-point arithmetic in financial calculations
- Rounding rules documented and consistently applied
- Transaction atomicity for all financial operations

**Validation:**
- Zod schemas defined for all input data structures
- Server-side validation on all API endpoints
- Client-side validation for immediate user feedback
- Type safety enforced throughout the application stack

### 2.2 Performance & Scalability

**Response Time Targets:**
- API response time: p95 under 200ms for CRUD operations
- Settlement calculation: under 500ms for groups up to 50 members
- Real-time event propagation: under 100ms latency

**Concurrency:**
- Support multiple concurrent users per group
- Optimistic locking for expense modifications
- Connection pooling for database access

### 2.3 Security Requirements

**Data Protection:**
- TLS 1.3 for all data in transit
- Database file encryption at rest
- Secure key management via environment variables or secret stores
- No sensitive data in client-side storage

**Authentication Security:**
- OAuth 2.0 compliance for third-party authentication
- Secure password hashing (bcrypt or argon2)
- Session timeout and automatic invalidation
- CSRF protection on state-changing operations
- Rate limiting on authentication endpoints

**Authorization:**
- Principle of least privilege for all operations
- Invite link expiration and one-time use options
- Audit logging for sensitive operations (expense creation/deletion, settlements)

### 2.4 Operational Requirements

**Observability:**
- Structured JSON logging with correlation IDs
- Error tracking with stack traces and context
- Request metrics (duration, status, endpoint)
- Business metrics (expenses created, settlements calculated, active users)
- Dashboard for key performance indicators

**Monitoring & Alerting:**
- Health check endpoints for uptime monitoring
- Database connection pool monitoring
- Memory and CPU utilization tracking
- Alert rules for error rate thresholds, response time degradation, authentication failures
- On-call rotation with automated notifications

**Backup & Recovery:**
- Automated daily database backups to external storage
- Point-in-time recovery capability
- Documented backup restoration procedure
- Backup integrity verification
- Retention policy: 30 days for daily backups, 12 months for monthly snapshots

**Release Management:**
- GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline with automated testing
- Branch protection requiring passing checks
- Semantic versioning for releases
- Blue-green or canary deployment strategy
- Automated rollback capability

### 2.5 Compliance & Privacy

**Data Privacy:**
- GDPR compliance for EU users (right to access, right to deletion, data portability)
- CCPA compliance for California users
- Privacy policy and terms of service
- User consent mechanisms for data processing
- Data retention limits and automated cleanup

**Data Minimization:**
- Collect only necessary user information
- Anonymous usage analytics where possible
- User data deletion scripts
- Clear data retention policies documented

---

## 3. Project Setup & Development Roadmap

### 3.1 Phase 0: Foundation Setup (Blocking Tasks)

**Timeline:** Days 1-2  
**Dependencies:** None  
**Deliverables:** Initialized repository with baseline infrastructure

**Critical Path Tasks:**

1. **Repository Initialization**
   - Create GitHub repository with appropriate visibility settings
   - Configure branch protection rules (require PR reviews, passing CI)
   - Set up GitHub Secrets for sensitive configuration
   - Initialize README with project overview and setup instructions

2. **Base Project Structure**
   - Initialize Next.js 16 project with TypeScript and App Router
   - Configure TypeScript strict mode and compiler options
   - Set up directory structure (app, lib, components, hooks, types, tests)
   - Configure absolute imports with path aliases

3. **CI/CD Pipeline Setup**
   - Create `.github/workflows/ci.yml` with parallel jobs:
     - Linting (ESLint with strict rules)
     - Type checking (tsc with noEmit)
     - Unit tests (Vitest)
     - Integration tests
     - Build verification
   - Configure caching for node_modules and build artifacts
   - Set up automated dependency updates (Dependabot or Renovate)

4. **Development Environment**
   - Create `.env.example` with all required environment variables
   - Document local development setup in README
   - Configure VS Code workspace settings and recommended extensions
   - Set up pre-commit hooks for linting and formatting

5. **Docker Configuration**
   - Create Dockerfile with multi-stage build
   - Create docker-compose.yml for local development
   - Document container build and run process
   - Health check configuration

**Success Criteria:**
- Repository is cloneable and runnable with documented commands
- CI pipeline runs successfully on push and PR
- All team members can run the project locally
- Docker builds successfully

---

## 4. Success Metrics

### 4.1 Development Velocity
- 95% of CI pipeline runs pass on first attempt
- Average PR cycle time under 24 hours
- Zero critical bugs in production first month
- Feature completion within estimated timelines

### 4.2 Application Performance
- API p95 response time under 200ms
- Settlement calculation under 500ms for typical groups
- Real-time event latency under 100ms
- Zero data loss or corruption incidents

### 4.3 User Experience
- Mobile responsive on all major devices
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliance score of 100%
- Zero accessibility blockers
- Intuitive UI validated through user testing

### 4.4 Operational Excellence
- 99.9% uptime in production
- Mean time to recovery (MTTR) under 30 minutes
- Zero security incidents
- Successful backup restoration drills

---

*Build this complete expense sharing application with all the features specified above.*

ems.task: Initialize Next.js 16 project with TypeScript, configure build tooling, set up CI/CD pipeline with lint/typecheck/test/build jobs, create Docker configuration, define core type definitions, and document setup

workers.task: Initialize Next.js 16 project with TypeScript, configure build tooling, set up CI/CD pipeline with lint/typecheck/test/build jobs, create Docker configuration, define core type definitions, and document setup

ems.task: Design and implement database schema with Drizzle ORM, create migrations for groups, users, expenses, settlements tables, implement repository pattern with type-safe CRUD operations, add database indexes and constraints

workers.task: Create database schema definitions with Drizzle ORM, including tables for users, groups, group_members, expenses, expense_splits, and settlements with proper indexes and constraints
workers.error: Claude Code process exited with code 1

workers.task: Implement Drizzle database connection, migration configuration, and generate migration files for SQLite with better-sqlite3 driver
Implement repository pattern with type-safe CRUD operations, base repository interface, and specific repositories for users, groups, expenses, and settlements with Zod validation schemas

ems.task: Implement authentication system with NextAuth.js, configure Google OAuth and credential providers, create session management, implement protected route middleware, add role-based access control logic

workers.task: Create NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth and credential providers, including auth options, callback handlers, and type definitions
Create database schema and adapter for authentication, including user accounts, sessions, and verification tokens with Drizzle ORM
Create session management middleware, protected route utilities, and role-based access control helpers for both client and server components

ems.task: Build REST API endpoints for groups (create, invite, manage members), implement invite link generation with expiration, add group archival/deletion with data retention policies

workers.task: Create group CRUD API endpoints (create, read, update, delete groups) with type definitions, validation schemas, and database operations
Implement invite link generation system with secure token creation, expiration handling, and invite verification endpoints
Build group member management APIs (add/remove members, role management) and group archival/deletion with data retention policies

ems.task: Build expense API endpoints for CRUD operations with audit trail, implement equal split calculation logic, add expense categorization and tagging, implement receipt attachment handling

workers.task: Create expense types, validation schemas, and API routes for CRUD operations with audit trail
Implement equal split calculation logic with debt graph computation and optimization
Implement expense categorization, tagging system, and receipt attachment handling

ems.task: Implement settlement engine with debt graph calculation, create optimal settlement path algorithm (minimize transactions), build settlement marking and tracking, add settlement history and verification endpoints

workers.task: Implement core settlement engine with debt graph calculation and optimal settlement path algorithm
Build settlement tracking, marking system, and database schema for settlements
Create settlement history and verification API endpoints with real-time notifications

ems.task: Implement Socket.io server for real-time updates, create event system for expense/balance changes, add connection management and reconnection logic, implement optimistic UI updates with conflict resolution

workers.task: Create Socket.io server initialization and configuration with custom Next.js API route handler, connection middleware, and authentication integration
Implement Socket.io event handlers for expense and balance changes, event broadcasting logic, and room management for groups
Create client-side Socket.io integration with React hooks for real-time updates, optimistic UI update logic, and conflict resolution system

ems.task: Build UI components using shadcn/ui for authentication (login, signup), group management (create, view settings), member management (add/remove, invite links), implement responsive layouts and mobile optimization

workers.task: Create authentication UI components (login form, signup form, auth layout) using shadcn/ui with responsive design and mobile optimization
Create group management UI components (create group dialog, group settings view, group list display) using shadcn/ui with responsive layouts
Create member management UI components (add member dialog, invite link generator, member list with remove functionality) using shadcn/ui with mobile-optimized layouts

ems.task: Build expense UI components including expense forms with validation, expense list with filtering, expense detail views with edit/delete, receipt upload component, implement expense categorization interface

workers.task: Create expense form components with validation, expense categorization interface, and receipt upload component
Create expense list component with filtering, sorting, and category-based views
Create expense detail view with edit/delete functionality and expense history tracking

ems.task: Build settlement UI showing debt visualization, optimal settlement suggestions, settlement confirmation flow, settlement history, implement real-time balance updates and notifications

workers.task: Create debt visualization components including DebtGraphView.tsx (interactive network graph showing who owes whom), DebtCard.tsx (individual debt display), and BalanceSummary.tsx (overall balance overview) with accompanying data hooks and types in lib/hooks/useSettlementData.ts

Create settlement suggestion system with OptimalSettlementSuggestions.tsx (displays minimized payment plan), SettlementSuggestionCard.tsx (individual settlement option), and SettlementCalculator.ts (algorithm for computing optimal settlements)

Create settlement confirmation and history flow with SettlementConfirmationModal.tsx (verification dialog), SettlementHistoryList.tsx (past settlements timeline), SettlementSuccess.tsx (completion animation), and related API routes in app/api/settlements/

analysisSummary: Build SplitSync - a production-ready expense sharing application with real-time synchronization, featuring group management, expense tracking, optimal settlement calculations, OAuth authentication, and comprehensive testing with CI/CD pipeline.
